rComments: i would take this class all over again because of how interesting this prof made it. It is rare i actually want to get up to go to online classes but i stayed so consistent with his lectures due to how well he presented them.

Colin Montpetit is an amazing professor who cares about his students. He is not intimidating and is open to having discussions with students in and outside of class. I found the course content to be difficult, but attending lectures was always a joy and exams were fair. If you practice and do the homework, you can get a good grade!

I love how he gave us a lot of participation marks to hopefully balance out all the exams, but that does not change the pain of them. It bothers me how he builds up the confidence in lecture then slaps with hard exams. They were better than BIO1140 though, but don't build us up just to tare us down. I rather a negative prof with standard midterms.

His teaching style is a bit weird and unconventional; he does not really lecture or give out notes.  He goes over concepts outlined in his powerpoints, and most of the class we answer WooClap questions.  Attending the lectures alone does however equip you with all the knowledge you need. His (long) exams are tricky, the answer key is quite specific

There were many activities to do but they were helpful and counted for easy participation marks. The lecture slides are not organized so going to the lectures help understand the content. Exam questions are reflective of questions seen during lecture and past exams, but there were a bit harder and took much longer than the time allocated for them.

i used to be a defender of this man but ive changed ways since this final. it was not designed for three hours, and im glad we got the entire day to do it. im disappointed in one of my fav profs for pulling this. if u like informal lecs + take home exams that are hard, hes ur guy. that being said he was a rlly great person- just not the best prof.

He is very unorganized and just rambles during his lectures. He does not prepare for his lecture and uses a very blank slide show as a template. Lectures always get off topic because he allows for discussion even though it is completely unrelated to course material. He cannot explain topics and will just repeat himself when you ask

He's a nice guy but honestly I just didn't vibe with the way he presented the course. A lot of interactive lectures with open discussion, but barely any focus on the core concepts. I would much rather prefer a systematic course with clear notes and slideshows. Exams were open book/24 hour so that was chill, but I honestly didn't learn much.

He was so good at explaining difficult concepts in his lectures, he is super engaging and is overall a very nice prof that cares about his students. His tests are somewhat difficult, but if you understand the concepts you should be fine - they're based on examples done in class that have a twist.

idk what everyone else is going on about. if u attend the lecs and listen the tests arent hard- you get all day to work on them and can easily refer to the zoom lecs. lots of freebie marks and a good engaging prof who actually cares. maybe the final will be bad but so far, its been good.

The lectures are long winded but use many examples to help conceptualize the content. Midterms are insanely difficult and loosely relevant. Good chances to raise your grade w participation marks and tedious labs but if possible just take it with another university and transfer the credit because u will not get an A unless you're already an expert.

Don't be mistaken by his amazing lectures and fun personality. His exams are absolutely preposterous. They really come out of left-field. If you have endured Alexandra Pettit, he is very similar. Nice but awful awful exams.

I am not at all good at genetics but the way prof Montpetit handled the online version of this class is great. Lots of participation marks to bump up your marks and he is super chill. The lectures are kind of confusing at times b/c he goes off on tangents but uses good examples. The exams are difficult but I managed through them so you can too :)

He's a great lecturer and the marking distribution makes it so you can always pull your grade up. I found his assignments to be poorly designed (questions with 10+ parts, questions where you have to select multiple right answers, content that hadn't been covered yet) but they're only marked for completion so it isn't too bad I guess.
Hes an amazing prof.

One of my favourite classes I've taken ever! I enjoyed it so much due to Dr. Montpetit's engaging teaching style. Some concepts were hard to grasp, but his examples really helped in making me understand them. Moreover, his evaluations were all open book, and super fair! He gave us the whole day to complete them. Plus

I am a fan of how Montpetit handled the online format. He tends to wander during class but his examples were reflective of tests. Three midterms but we're given the entire day to complete them. If you took good notes and paid attention, you'd do well. The final was a lot harder than midterms and had a couple mistakes, however it was only worth 20%.

I finished the course with 25/25 on the assignments and in the lab, but a 24/50 in the class, since I didn't pass the course component because of his syllabus, he changed the 73 that I earned into a 40. Basically, you have to pass everything, and if you don't he can just give you a 40 automatically.

Colin has a knack for making a mountain out of a molehill. You need to cut through his words and examples to actually figure out what's going on. Open book midterms were great, the final less so. Try for CSL but chances are its not happening, don't get your hopes up. As a person, however, he's hilarious, very kind. Love the guy, but he's wordy.

Very inspirational. Didn't like his convoluted explanations in the lectures, so try seeking the resources he listed if some concepts don't make sense. Passionate about our success in Genetics. Opt for CSL so you can buffer your mark because the final was brutal.

Im glad I gave him his lecture style a chance. It was unusual to get so many examples and so little definition and background but it made me understand the concepts better. The midterms were okay... a little challenging. The final was brutal tho, took me 15 hours! Overall, awesome prof and class!!!

Midterms are hard. Teaches like he is having a conversation. Final was very difficult and took almost 17hrs to complete (wish I was kidding) and at the end I almost failed the final exam by 8%. To make it worse the lab quizzes are horrible (talk about the program instead of the actual concept). If you can take it in French do it. (trust me)

Good prof, interesting and well explained lectures, comfortable class atmosphere. He gives tons of participation and questions in lecture that hints at midterm+final. Gave tons of time to do assessments during COVID-19 times. He overestimates students brain power though, we cant do this difficulty in should take u 3hrs- took me 10+ fml

I'm not sure why Colin has a low rating, but he is an amazing professor. Mastering Genetics and other participation marks should be easy mark boosters!! Online BIO2133 were 3 open-book exams that we had all day to complete, and the final exam was a 24hr take-home. If you attend every lecture and take notes, you don't even need to study.

Honestly one of my favourite professors. I don't even like genetics and yet this was the class I looked forward to the most plus I actually did well in it. You could tell he care for his students and genuinely wants you to learn. Midterms and exams are fair and easy if you attend class. Overall a great professor and I highly recommend!

Great prof! Mid terms and final were open book and you had the entire day to complete them (in the online semester) and they were low key easy. Best grade this semester! He also makes class interesting and fun by always trying to give you cool facts and stories. 9.75/10

One of the best teachers ive had, gives so many opportunities for easy marks. so nice and clearly cares about his students and what he teaches. easy to contact for questions and dealt with online school in the best ways possible
10/10 prof! amazing and down to earth, definitely would take more courses with him.

I really don't understand how he doesn't have a rating of 5 because he TOTALLY deserves it. An absolute gem, he is extremely caring especially during online classes. He wants everyone to succeed and does his best to connect with students even after class. Not a single negative thing i can say about him. He is a blessing. Midterms are very fair.

Super bon prof! Son cours m'a très bien préparé pour les cours de 4ième année. Il est toujours disponible pour répondre aux questions, il s'assure que les élèves comprennent et il est juste pour la correction des exams. Ses examens sont "think outside the box" alors assure toi de bien comprendre les simulations et les principes importants. Merci!

The fact that his grade is a 2.5/5 is shameful. He is an amazing prof and an even better person. He uses a more example based approach which is fine as his exams are of the exact same difficulty (not to mention open-book). His class was NOT hard and he made sure everyone strived. The Mastering chemistry and surveys should BOOST your grades.

If you are prepared to learn a lot of the concepts on your own, then go for it with him. Not necessarily a bad prof but he doesn't explain concepts very well and does a lot of practice in class. Get ready for him constantly asking for people to turn on cameras if no one has them on.

Dr. Montpetit is an incredible professor. I know a lot of people have a hard time with him at first because his teaching is very evolved; however, trust me in the long run you'll be thankful for his teaching style so may as well get over that stubbornnes right away. He is a good lecturer and he truly cares for the well-being of his students.

Dr Montpetit is an exceptional prof. This man not only helped me succeed in this course, but also all of my other courses (10.0 sGPA). He made me adore genetics. He prompts us to think outside the box, using open-ended questions that prompt critical thinking. He also cares about his students and their health.

His rating is way too low for such an amazing professor! Hes one of my favorite professors of all time and I seriously dont understand all the bad reviews. He cares so much about his students and hes so passionate about genetics and teaching. An absolute gem. Not sure what my final mark is going to be but Im certain itll be fair. No surprises

Of the assigned readings, you only really need to focus on the bold/italicized words in the textbook. This isnt stressed by him, but it saved me a LOT of time with the readings. Doing that, then just following the practice problems he does in class made this class much more manageable. Homework is graded by participation, which is pretty cool.

I hate the lectures. He is all over the place and I feel bad because he thinks he is actually helping us but half the time you dont really know where the lecture is going. Be prepared to teach yourself.

I don't know why this prof is rated so low, he is very understanding and makes his classes fun. his exams are not very difficult but I took them online and there is no proctoring and he gives you the whole day. great guy!

Dr Montpetit is an amazing prof. Be ready for the challenge - it is a VERY difficult class. The exams were based on stimulations and questions were mostly "think outside the box" but he makes sure you have all the knowledge you need in order to answer them. PARTICIPATE in class and UNDERSTAND the content. Don't memorize or you will sink deep.

This prof did not teach a single thing all semester. We had zoom "classes" twice a week but he just read over the objectives for the module of the week. You had to learn everything by yourself. Every week we had to go over a module and some of them had a lot of content His grading scheme was pretty fair but the second midterm was brutal.

This guy is the biggest mess I've ever come across. I went to 2 lectures the whole semester and never went back, it's a waste of time. Just remember to get the participation marks and just study on your own IGNORING ALL THE EXTRA STUFF HE POSTS. It's really not hard to get an A+, only listen to the lectures and don't look at his messed brightspace

AVOID. exams are long and full of trick questions, so you either can read them out carefully or answer them all. His lectures have zero teaching in them. the concepts he goes over are not complicated at all, but the way he explains them (on tests and in class) makes zero sense. If you can, take CSL because it will save. your. grade.

I think he means well but he tries so hard to make classes like highschool and interactive that he teaches you NOTHING. All the content is so straight forward in theory but the test questions are horribly worded and make no sense. Luckily there's lots of participation marks but honestly avoid this guy. Ruined a class I was really looking forward to

His lecture is just echo360 based. The lab is designed to fail you -> Do CSL if possible. His exam wording is so confusing that even you definitely know the concept but you will still get it wrong. Didn't learn any useful information from this class. Try to get his past midterms, he recycles questions.

Flipped classroom is ineffective & wastes time, just teach yourself & do echo questions from home. Concepts are easy but exams are all trick questions & mind games instead of evaluating your knowledge/application. He teaches incorrect info (claims that Edwards Syndrome is a type of Down Syndrome, & that sexgender among others "facts"). Avoid him.
Honestly, he does not teach anything at all. You have to teach the whole course to yourself.

He does not explain ANYTHING, I sometimes had the feeling he cheated his way into getting his degree because I was given the impression he knew nothing of what he was teaching. Avoid at all costs, take it in French if you can. Save yourself from this awful teaching method. Absolute garbage, put in a lot of hours into teaching yourself.

Colin genuinely cares about helping people with different learning styles succeed in science/uni. Not your average straight up memorization course. Midterms were out of few marks (30) and got ok marks on those but 100% on everything else-lots of participation and I did CSL which I definitely recommend, especially if you propose your own placement!

After reading reviews, I was paranoid to take this class. His class is tough but possible to get an A+ especially if you TAKE CSL INSTEAD OF THE LAB. You can do well if you are naturally smart OR If you go to every office hour/before and after class, practice all past midterms, in-class questions, mastering genetics, and study with smart friends.

My favourite prof in science hands down. Will 100% take him again if I can. We is very clear on what he expects of you. Genetics is NOT about memorization, it is about making connections and problem solving. People aren't giving him enough credit. He truly cares about you and your learning. Its helpful if you study in groups to bounce ideas around.
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', 'Accessible outside class', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: he's seriously not as bad as everyone makes him out to be on this site, is the class hard? yes. but its more challenging than it is unreasonable, be prepared to work hard. other than that he's a nice guy and is clear when he conveys the material.

Honestly, one of the most disorganized professors. For each module I put in 15 hours of readings and still ended up with mediocre marks. Would not take again. Heavy courseload and what we are supposed to learn is not specified.
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', 'Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: uOttawa NEEDS to hire a new genetics professor. He does not teach in the lectures and a big chunk of the participation marks come from clicking random things on brightspace, making it really easy to miss getting the marks. He doesn't take into account that his students have 4/5 other classes and expects us to work on genetics 24/7 outside of class.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read', 'Participation matters']

rComments: The worst ever, hes such a mess, tries to use scientifically proven methods to teach but is a disaster, he is arrogant and doesnt even teach in class, honestly avoid him or take the class at another university

I don't understand his bad rating. His way of teaching is more interactive but if you participate and ask the right questions you should do fine. He is a really caring prof and accommodated me when I had a personal issue come up near the 2nd midterm. All in all this class is about understanding and applying concepts and not just memorizing notes

The worst prof I've ever had. Extremely disorganized messy course, this "hybrid" online and lecture method is terrible. keep avoiding this course until a new professor teaches it because it will bring down your GPA. lectures are a complete waste of time, he doesn't teach ANYTHING and you just end up even more confused. avoid, avoid, avoid!!!

I didn't like his hybrid teaching and would prefer regular lectures. His lectures seemed easy and he always emphasized how everyone should get 100%. Midterms and exam were tricky. No room for making mistakes. Labs and participation are easy grades. But exams brought my mark down :(

I think that the reception to this class would be a lot different if Colin stopped trying to convince us that this was the best class in the world. I was not a fan of his approach to the flipped classroom structure he provided, and his tests are full of trick questions that will stump you if you misread the questions, even if you know your stuff.

Montpetit seems like a nice guy, but he's a horrible professor (flipped classroom). I went into this class thinking it would be an easy A, but boy was I bamboozled. The content itself is very simple, pretty much everything you would expect. But between the nonsensical babbling and the trick questions, you're likely to get a bad mark and a headache.

Super vague guy and really odd to say the least. Tells you he wants everyone to do well and proceeds to ask trick question after trick question on the midterms. Exam was okay but just like the midterms, no time to check your answers thoroughly. Good weighting system and lots of free marks though.
Why is he the only prof for this course?

Probably the worst professor that uOttawa has to offer. This man cannot teach for his life. It's like he just shows up for the sake of showing up. Midterm and Exams are out of a small amount of marks eg. 25-30 marks so each questions was like 4%. Little room for error in a short amount of time (1 hour ONLY!)
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Test heavy', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Looking back I can see what he was going for but his execution was poor. Two main issues with this class: 1) learning objectives are very vague and may as well ask you to solve string theory 2) midterms were out of so little marks (30 and 25) that you can get easily screwed over & there isn't enough time to check over your answers. Okay as a prof.

He's a good prof and he definitely knows his stuff, but the hybrid course model didn't work for me because you need to do the readings in the textbook each week (which are very long and monotonous). The lectures are a lot easier than the course material because he just does Echo360 questions and examples. The exams kind of reflected the lectures.
teacherRatingTags: ['Test heavy', 'Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: The worst course I have His blended learning is horribly executed, he does NOT explain ANY concepts clearly but immediately jumps into practice questions The readings are absolutely useless and go into details completely unrelated to the course. Exams are VERY tricky even if you study all of the concepts perfectly it is still unlikely to succeed

Like a previous commenter, I think Dr. Montpetit is misunderstood. His blended learning technique just means you have Mastering problems to do online, which is actually a good mark boost; he didn't "cancel" any lectures, some were just optional ( no Echo questions for marks). The key to doing well in this course is to PRACTICE. Office hrs helpful.

I have studied relatively hard for the midterms and haven't done well on either. Even if you study the course material and know it really well, that is no guarantee for even a passing grade. His exam questions are more critical thinking and too little time is allocated towards the individual exam (1 hr) in order to make time for a group exam.
He is distracted and his blending learning technique is poorly executed.

Dr. Montpetit is one of the best biology related professor that I ever had in four years. He tries his best to give students a higher score. He has group exams for midterms and final exam, try to find solid groupmate at the beginning of the class.

HOW DOES THIS GUY HAVE A RATING ABOVE 2? I've learned more about his cats and his kids than actual course content. The only redeemable feature is the 15% participation, but even that won't keep you afloat. Might as well take the french version cause you'll have the same odds of getting an A+ (0%). btw don't bother with the textbook - it won't help.
Honestly the hardest course I have taken at this university.

Claim to fame of none of his kids having major genetic disorders. Told a girl in the class that there is only 2 genders & the chaos that ensued was hilarious. Exam questions are tricky but fair if you prepare yourself (I.e. 50% chance for boy or girl). Class wasnt very difficult.
It's been two weeks of classes and I know more about his cats than genetics.

Colin is the most caring professor I've had in my three years of school. Although the course was difficult at first, he gives good feedback and we redo midterm questions as a group, making sure we understand the concepts and not just memorize information. Do not take this class if you're looking for a bird course, but take it if you want to learn.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: He's honestly one of the best profs I've had so far. He has great lectures where he asks questions that are similar to the midterm and exam questions. He also has extra help sessions before and after class. He really cares about his students and is a fair grader. He also gives an extra credit assignment which is super helpful!

Lots of students study a course only for the sake of getting it done and over with. In this course you have to learn and understand the material to be able to answer his questions. He doesn't test theory, he tests for application. Group exams are super fun, and the test itself is doable. Compared to other courses like biochem, it's a piece of cake.

I feel he is misunderstood. Contrary to popular belief, he's a good lecturer, and a lot more engaging than most bio profs. However, I do think that he should have been more clear in his expectations. Simply saying "know everything on the course objectives/planner" is way too broad. It was very hard studying for his class.

Such a great professor! Very approachable and genuinely cares about his students and their success. Blended learning approach is different but makes you engage in the material you are learning and gives up so much of his time to help students. However, if youre a student who likes to do bare minimum you will not do well in this class.

Course work is very heavy (a lot of learning on your own) but the materials provided are fairly easy to understand, and any difficult topics are covered in class. The professor is entertaining, passionate about the material he teaches, and really cares about his students succeeding (LOTS of participation marks, group exams are a good mark boost)

He uses a "blended learning" approach which means you are left to teach yourself the material once a week. Due to this, if he doesn't have time to cover something in class (as he goes off on tangents easily) he still expects everyone to be familiar with it and the reading content will be on the exams even if he never mentions its existence.

The worst prof. He himself is actually genuinely nice and approachable, however he is extremely ill-suited towards a professor role. Blended Learning is more suited toward teaching farm animals in kindergarten than toward teaching complex genetics in a university setting. No train of thought throughout lectures, hard to follow and hard to study for

The worst prof I've had in my three years at uOttawa. Arrogant, constantly boasting about his "revolutionary" teaching techniques (which are actually garbage). Condescending and annoying. Tries too hard to be unique. Bad lecturer, looses his train of thought every 2 minutes. And group exams? Really??? Avoid his class if you can.

Focus on comprehension instead of memorisation. Really hard to understand exam's question (formulation). Even if you study, you will not understand the question that you have to answer... A lot of free points (participation).

Hybrid class is great if you learn on your own. Textbook is really useful because he doesn't give much details in lectures. Exams are a lot like Echo questions, weekly homework are more like a lecture test, but only counts as participation. He admits when he's wrong and changes answers accordingly. Participation is worth 15% and are easy marks.

Mr Montpetit is truly a great prof, he is funny, interesting and puts an incredible amount of effort in making students understand his concepts. He is very approachable, easy to talk to and gives extra credit. However make sure you keep track of all the homework cause there is a LOT

Great professor, he incorporates many different teachings techniques. Using echo clicker questions to encourage participation and lots of independent at home studying. Lots of interactive activities that help in the comprehension of the subject and many studies of real life case studies. Would love to have another class with Colin

Montpetit's Hybrid Learning takes a while to get used to is worth it by the final. Course material is really interesting but organization of slides and lectures is dodgy and you have to go through them alongside the textbook after class to really know what's happening. The word "concept" is heard once every 2 minutes.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Well first off, ignore everything he says about the textbook being necessary and any "required readings" he puts, it's all a waste of time. Show up to class and do the ECHO360 stuff and then go home and do the Mastering assignments. Then for studying watch the podcasts and ANYTHING he touches on, even just briefly, is important, nothing else is

Colin is probably the WORST professor I have ever had! He thinks his blended learning is amazing (it actually sucks), why am I paying so much tuition to only be taught once a week? He does not teach in the lectures and it is so hard to study for his exams when you have no clue how to. Get those bin points and create a dream team group for the exams

This class has the potential to be really interesting, genetics is an awesome topic, but Colin makes it so unbearable. He barely teaches in class and can't even remember what a ribosome is used for. He assigns readings that are your only way of learning but are also way too specific. The best way to learn is to do the readings and the mastering.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Participation matters']

rComments: Don't bother with the textbook. Make sure to understand the concepts, which, since he does a poor job explaining it in class, would be better aided by other online resources such as wikipedia. Tests do not resemble clicker questions or Mastering, so don't bother with memorization.

Don't study from the book. In fact don't even get the book. Imo, the keys to success (shout out to DJ Khaled) in his class are to learn directly from his slides and podcasts. For practice, make sure you do any lecture problems he throws up! Mastering Q's are also helpful. This mans tries hard to trick you on exams so STAY WOKE. Good Luck!

It's hard to understand HOW to study for his tests. Read the book it can really help you understand what happening in depth because in lecture he skims every subject. Look at learning objectives and study/read accordingly. Participation marks are awesome tho! just show up! Lab question are on exam so understand ur labs and the lab quizzes
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read', 'Participation matters']

rComments: I honestly really enjoyed this class and found all the content super interesting. It is nice that he doesn't test on details, just overall concepts, therefore as long as you understand the underlying concepts of genetics you can do well on all the exams, which are all application based. He's an entertaining lecturer and super helpful/approachable

THE. WORST. PROF. EVER. He has no clue what to talk about in his class so he spits out random words relating to genetics that have no focus. Tries so hard to make you like him and believe his teaching works, it doesn't. The textbook is awful, and he has no sense of how to communicate the subject matter to a body of students. His exams are too short
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: The worst class I ever take. It is almost impossible to get 80 on his individual exams. His group exam is just waste of time, and it can only slightly increase your mark ( less than 5) . The professor do not focus on teaching but too much about his profession life. Take other prof's class if you can!

The course is set up for you to get a bad marks. The labs quizzes are worth like 1.5 points, and the entire midterm is worth 25-30 points. Any wrong answer screws you up completely. The WORST course I've ever taken.

I used to love genetics until having Montpetit as a prof. I'm a student who generally does well in my courses but I am having a hard time doing well in his class. He doesn't spend time  teaching and is very rude. Like the rater below said, he is the worst prof in the science faculty. Don't take this course as an elective.

Awful Prof. He is the worst proffesor in the science faculty. Brags about how great his teaching style is when it really isn't. His research is on science education but he is the worst educator I have ever had. Also very rude when students ask questions. His group exams are pointless as well. Avoid at all costs.

The absolute worst prof at uottawa. avoid at all costs. he cannot teach yet likes to pretend he can and always talks about how amazing his teaching style is. the readings are useless and the group portion of the exam is a waste of time since it can only raise your mark by a little bit. please avoid this arrogant, rude prof if possible.

WORST PROF EVER. He teaches concepts about genetics without actually giving any context whatsoever to the textbook or anywhere you could go to reinforce your knowledge. The textbook is pretty much useless. His exams are not fair at all; wording is completely ambiguous and he will not clarify when you ask him on midterms.

like to yell out 'omigod' many many times in class. but besides that does not thoroughly review what you need to know for the midterms. Very ambiguous what to study (lectures notes barely cover material) besides huge volumes of only partially necessary textbooks readings. Probably a narcissist..

This is not an easy class. At all. But if you show up, you listen, you read the slides, you participate and you ask questions, you will ace it. It's all hands-on and apply the concepts for both the labs and exams. But Colin is very friendly, approachable and easy to understand. tough grader but if you put in the effort, you've nothing to fear.

Dr. Montpetit's cellular physiology class was by far one of my favourites. You cannot just mindlessly memorize, you have to actually understand the concepts. This class made me think (ALOT) but in a good way; I've never learnt more in a class, nor have I ever appreciated a class this much before. He is also very friendly and approachable!

No need to go to lectures, you can do the participation at home or after lectures (he keeps them open). I learned nothing from his class. I wrote the exam with past knowledge from gr 11 bio and biostats and managed to get A+ . Reading the assigned readings did not help with the exams. Use logic and you should be fine.

He is charismatic &  easygoing. His teaching style is 1 in class lecture & 1 optional get together for reviewal over confusing topics. Its great, you get extra time for other things. Pro: free 15% of participation marks, Con: hence class is mandatory. Labs are annoying, about 10-15hours write-up for me. Exams/Midterms: NEED TO STUDY ALOT

Genetics was easily my least favourite class of university. His tests are out of 30 marks and about 3/4 of the test are comprised of  multiple choice and true or false that are very ambiguous. Probably the worst lecturer I have every had. I've gotten A+ in most of my courses yet was unable to crack an 80 on his midterms. Enjoy...

I tried to give this guy a chance, and often found myself frustrated with him when I did. He is very full of himself, sometimes nice, but then other times an ass,  I think he is a very emotional person, so when you talk to him in person, you can can get either side, also shouldn't be teaching and he talks WAY too much about his personal life!
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'EXTRA CREDIT', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Not a huge fan of his style of teaching. Definitely be prepared to teach yourself the material. Also read exam questions carefully because he'll usually word them weirdly to try to trick you. Overall not a hard course, but I don't feel like I actually learned anything.

Gives 15% participation in class, so go to class! Montpetit is a nice guy, sometimes a bit weird, but he means well and teaches well. All tests are 2 parts: one part individual and one part team. Wasn't a huge fan of it in the beginning but it can really bring your grade up. Make sure you have a good group to work with. Good class overall!

He does not teach. You simply have to read everything on your own- and hope you do well. People walked out of the second midterm thinking they aced it- but really did terrible. He's rude, arrogant, and his final was ridiculous. Half the time is spent advertising the blended format- no thanks.

Comments are pretty accurate on here. Group exams were such a waste of bloody time. Even if you do better on them, your final mark on the exam can only go up a couple of points. I would have much preferred more time to write the bloody things. Prof was pretty full of himself and spent too much time talking about his personal life.

Buy the textbook, show up to the midterms and final and walk out with an A. Textbook readings given online cover significantly more than what is testable with the sole purpose of class to point out what parts of readings you have already done are irrelevant. Exams are straight forward and labs are a joke, not a fun class but a reasonable mandatory.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Beware of pop quizzes', 'EXTRA CREDIT']

rComments: Worst prof that I've had in my three years at uOttawa. Lazy, arrogant, and self-absorbed: he doesn't teach you the material, only it's application. He also intentionally tricks you on the exams. The only pros to the course are 1) 15% of your final grade is participation and 2) the lab component is an easy 20%.  Avoid him at all costs!

he's probably the worse prof of my whole academic path in uottawa. All the concepts that i used in his exams are not taught in class... the lab section is even worse, your grade in that section depends on the TA that is correcting. He spends way too much time on his lame jokes and not actually on teaching. avoid by all means!!

I enjoyed Prof. Montpetit's genetics class. He had interactive lectures that kept students' attention and the material was interesting. It IS a hybrid course, meaning that half the course is spent in-class and the other half must be self-taught. First midterm was fair, second was more difficult. Lists what he expects you to know on Blackboard.

l I had to take my labs to the Lab manager because there was an issue with improper grading. Class will start out well and the first midterm is great. However, when the second midterm comes he WILL use it to adjust grades . Although he  may tell you in class he wouldn't do that. He did. Gist group statsa re also very skewed to make it look good.
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', 'Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: He tries so hard to be interesting, funny, and eccentric in class - but he's not. Lectures are utterly useless, filled with tangents, bad jokes, Star Wars references, and swears. Believes his way of teaching is the best, but in actuality you come out of the course with the same knowledge coming in. Tests are doable, but marking scheme is rigid.

worst mark in all of uni for someone who tends to do well in even the harder courses. The material isn't bad but he's NOT a good prof & midterms don't reflect what you really know. One mistake counts a lot since the whole test is out of 30 points. Assigns useless readings and u literally have to guess whats guna be on the test. AVOID if you can!!!

Worst teaching style ever.. Didnt benefit from not having class once every week, total waste of time. sigh. why are we paying for this again?? were paying to skip class.. you NEED to teach yourself EVERYTHING.
avoid him or you regret, labs are so unnecessary, not fair exam not fair method to teach genetic
if you need to learn something and get good grade search for another prof. One of the worst prof in biology dep

Probably the worst prof at the uni. Doesn't teach ANYTHING, spends class time wasting it on useless or super easy subject matter. Thinks his method of teaching is the best(spoiler alert:it's not). ALWAYS bashes other courses, is really rude when spoken to, can't predict what will be on the midterms and they are hard. Just take genetics in french...

this guy made easy course into horrible course, he doesnt know how teach, none of the student learn a single thing from this course just avoid him.  Hell throw lots of material at you with no help,  if u want to take this course you should know genetics form the other courses  just avoid him and wait till some other guy come and teach this.

This guy made it seem like this course would be very interesting and fun on the first day of school... Do not fall for that. He does not even know how to teach. I'm paying for this course to actually learn something in class... not to teach myself over half of the material in a short period of time. Avoid!!
He thinks he's so cool, but doesn't know his teaching style is the worst
Horrible professor. He doesn't teach at all, and thinks his hybird way of teaching is effective. Its just a waste of time to go to his classes.

He consistently contradicts the textbook and generally doesn't seem to really understand the content; acts like class material is a matter of opinion and never teaches anything solid. Not sure if he's rusty from never lecturing or what. TAs don't help: they just tell you to re-watch what the podcast. How is that supposed to do anything!?
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Participation matters', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: The only reason I'm going to class is for the stupid "bin points." This has got to be the worst professor at uOttawa, worse than any arts professors which is saying something. We literally spent three quarters of one class listing how males are physiologically different from females. He doesn't teach genetics; you have to learn it yourself.

took this class last year, does 2 part exams (individual and group) brings your mark up if you pick the right group. Asks tricky questions on the application of genetics, you have to REALLY understand to do well.

No matter how hard I tried, I just couldn't succeed in this course, and that's never been a problem for me. His evaluations are mostly MC and are tricky. I did not like having group exams as there was less time to do the individual portion. Avoid the class if you can; I wish I could have. If you can't, may the odds be ever in your favour!

I lost motivation for this class and completely ignored it after the first midterm since he cancelled the second lecture of the week after that point. He says you can do the readings at your own time BUT you won't get anything he talks about during class. For the final I just read the chapters assigned for every week I missed class and got a B
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: Non-traditional teaching methods (readinglearning module online during weekend, then use class time to solve problems together, not much lecturing), takes a bit of getting used to but if you put in some effort, you'll do really well.

You don't have to go to class to do good (Stopped going after the first miterm) but you do need the participation marks to boost up your grade, easy 15% and will help you in the end. Final was long and confusing and was out of time to finish it, but in the group exam we got 93% and that pretty much saved my grade.
Group exams  stupid. Cancels every second lecture. Doesn't teach much on the lectures he does have. Would not take again.
Montpetit is a good prof. His tests are tough but fair. He makes you work hard, but that's good preparation for future years at Ottawa U.

Lectures are extremely confusing, but attendance is mandatory. It seems clear that his grasp on the material he teaches is weak (constantly makes blunders, mixes up ideaskey words etc).   I believe he believes that his teaching methodology is far more effective than it is. As someone who loves genetics, I had a really hard time enjoying class
Awful. Doesn't teach during lectures (loves to swear instead), half of which are cancelled. Dropped it when I changed programs (best decision). Avoid at all costs.

If you get hit by a truck and wake up from a coma a week later, he'll fight to keep your assignment grade 0 if the assignment was up for a day before you got hit. He's not a very reasonable or compassionate man. I hope for the sake of future biology students that he was only testing out a weird new teaching method in 2014.

This class is bad (it's easy, but Dr. Montpetit will drive you up the wall!). The hybrid format sucks; he doesn't lecture, and instead, does stupid little exercises in class, and cancels every other lecture. The amount of tangents he goes off an is UNREAL. Also, George isn't there to help you  she sits in a chair, frowning.
If every prof at uOttawa was like Montpetit... I'd be an A+ student loving what I'm studying.

He does a really good job at keeping his class engaged!His questions are more about practice than material. They really make you think, and its about learning his method of questioning and tricks. TAKE YOUR TIME ANSWERING. its hard, but practice!

He is a really nice guy and easily approachable. He tries to keep genetics from getting to dry, so I give him credit. But some lectures are kind of boring. The textbook is of no use at all. His teaching and explanations of concepts after the second midterm aren't as good as at beginning of year. If you have trouble, go office hours.

A chill guy when you attend his first lecture. However, after 3-4 classes, you realize that he cannot explain any genetics concepts! Always dodged people's questions by telling you to look at the  clicker Qs and "the person beside you" to help answer the question. I actually liked the group exam, but for the individual exam - RUN.

I actually really enjoyed his teaching style - between the clicker Qs, the mastering assignments and the labs, you will get a massive buffer to your grade. The clickers Qs were also major to my understanding. Groups exams were fine but they REALLY pressed me for time in the individual portion, making me mess up a lot of easy/free questions.

Decent lecturer, and does alot of practice questions in class. Was VERY pressed for time during all exams (never before been an issue for me)- this is due to his implementation of group exams, even during finals (which I believe he has been put into practice to benefit his own personal agenda, as his primary research focuses on 'science education')

I was pumped to take this course and in the first lecture it was interesting to hear about Dr Montpetit's extra research regarding how students learn, and how much they enjoy the course. However many lectures later he is vague and doesnt give clear explanations for his questions. I really expected more from this course and am really disappointed.

He really does not know how to teach, his teaching methods are really bad, and does not actually explain the concepts at all. The midterms and final are half group exams making you have less time to write the individual exam which is way harder and worth more of your grade. His multiple choice questions are completely ambiguous, hes not a good prof

I don't know why everyone is being so rude, I think he tried really hard to make the lectures informative and interesting. Lots of opportunities for bonus marks, learning outcomes tell you exactly what will be on exams. Only tested on in-class material so I didn't bother using the book at all. Always available to help/answer q's

He needs to stop teaching. He is always complaining about maybe collapsing in front of the class and how sick he is and etc. He never explains concepts that well and he tries to be involved in the labs but isn't helpful. You have no choice but to be with him if you have to take genetics. Just be prepared.

He is quite annoying, but a decent teacher. However, it shocked me how smug and arrogant he acted (along with marc charette who is incredibly rude) when i tried to take the time to get extra help during his office hours. Therefore, i struggled with the material more than i needed to

If you hate learning from a textbook this class isn't for you. Lecture are pointless because they make no sense and are hard to follow and to make notes on. However, they are mandatory, so enjoy sleeping through them. Tests are like Housemans, so pretty hard. Final exam ... just brace yourself.
WOW this prof is actually the worst.... Hated this class.

Montpetit himself is super nice, super willing to help, and tries his best to make class interactive and fun! Although, at times it seemed like he wasn't really sure what he was saying, and therefore made his explanation very vague and unclear. Even listening to the podcast multiple times did not help to clarify his meaning. Great guy though!

He is a great guy and you never see someone care so much about their students. He spends time with you if you need. BUT... he does not focus on explaining the basic concepts. He just rambles a lot. He also claims to not mark like Houseman but instead does just that.

He spends as much time as you need to help you and explain stuff to you. I've rarely encountered a professor who cares so much about students success. Especially in a class with 700+ students like this one. He makes time for you no matter what.
Helpful and enthusiastic prof. Liked his lectures, encourages us to apply info learned.

He's nice but his lectures were very confusing and not very understandable and I basically learned everything I needed to know from the textbook. Midterms were alright (similar structure to Houseman's tests) but exam was very difficult with the problem solving questions. It's too bad he's the only genetics prof. Don't take it if you don't have to!!
Lectures were off topic, unfair marking schemes, he whined through multiple lectures.. altogether awful prof.

His midterm were fair, but the long answer questions on the final were brutal. He tried to motivate his students, but it didn't really work out. He isn't that great of a lecturer. He can get boring at times as well.

Enthusiastic and upbeat prof, always willing to help. However,his teaching is questionable and simplifies matter to a confusing level. Use the textbook, as most material you need to know will only be mentioned briefly in class

Exam marking schemes are rigid, which is standard for a biology course. An enthusiastic professor that tries his best to engage the class via clicker questions, but overall it's up to the student to do well on his exams. Memorize definitions like there's no tomorrow.

Overall, and ineffective prof.  His lectures are not informative and you will have to read the textbook to learn anything in this class.  Midterm marking schemes are not fair and do not reflect what the question is asking for.

down to earth, extremely chill and a nice prof to have a chat with. his expectations are always clear and he goes above and beyond to help his students understand concepts and prepare for exams. Marry me Colin Monpetit?
course is very practical and well organized
Solid prof, who is knows his stuff.

Took so many courses with Dr. MontPetit. He goes out of his way to be available to students for questions. He is fair and gives accurate instructions on how to suceed in his courses, however he does expect a lot of independent study and hard work from his students.
Course was good so was the prof.
His lectures and posted notes are great!
I expected this course to be tough, but I was pleasantly surprised that it was comparable to my other courses. Montpetit kept me on top of the material. Follow what he says if you want to do well.
Prof Montpetit had a good grasp of genetics, he got me to think about how to go about solving problems in a more logical way than I use to.
Pretty good prof. Tells it like it is. You'll get a good mark if you put in the effort.
If you follow the advice he gives, like doing the study questions...you'll do ok in his course. Found him friendly during office hrs too.
Montpetit was ok Good attitude towards us.

It seems as though he has a very superficial understanding of the course material. He sometimes appears to be aware of the gaps in his understanding, but responds to students' questions with a defensive attitude, sometimes bordering on overt hostility, particularly when his grasp of the subject matter is at risk of being shown to be limited.
Montpetit did a good job and taught things well. He tries different approaches to teaching which is a nice change.
good prof, questions are hard, but fair, looking forward to taking another course with him in upper years

I enjoyed Dr. Montpetit's teaching style, since he pushed me to analyze concepts from at a deeper understanding compared to my other undergrad courses. I'm definitely more comfortable tackling questions that require synthesis and applied knowledge. The process is challenging but I know that the skills he's taught me are really valuable.

He just shouldn't be teaching genetics.  Since he doesn't understand it well, he doesn't make much sense in class and the problems on tests are much more difficult than the ones done in class.  I got an A+ in the course but still found him ineffective.  Study the slides and what you don't understand, read in the textbook.

Makes mistakes all the time and will not budge to anyone, Horrible teaching and everything is straight from the textbook. Incredibly boring and waste so much time on case studies. Midterms were all MCQ and then out of nowhere gives us an exam out of 125 with 25 MC and the rest long answer leaving us unprepared. Came in to exam 98% left with 81

Why is this man on the Senate Teaching Committee for uOttawa? This is the worst second-year course you can take. I received an A+, and am seriously not satisfied with this course. Montpetit keeps adding these useless case studies, which have nothing to do with genetics and are designed to win him a teaching award. Switch to French section.

Absolute insult to the institution we call university. He understands no genetics, refuses to admit mistakes, makes incredibly hard exams in order to lower the average out of spite, refuses to discuss performance of exams with students and is extremely rude, when students, who truly understand the material, confront him.

Although he is not the greatest genetics prof, he is GREAT in this class! Knows his stuff, conveys it well and midterm questions really reflect class material. Don't judge him by his poor performance in genetics (BIO2133) as he is a MUCH better teacher and actually a really nice guy! Very helpful if you're willing to learn and come to class!
Montpetit is a GREAT prof! He didn't baby us, but challenged us to evaluate and apply concepts.

Montpetit doesn't know much about genetics in general, and he doesn't like to admit that his midterm answers are wrong despite of clear indication in the textbook.  The case studies are a waste of time that are designed to help him more than the students.  He and Heinermann are the best combination in the university to make your life miserable. :(

Worst professor I have ever had. Try to switch to a different professor, or teach yourself using the text. He seems to have only a small understanding of the material himself. Extremely poor at explaining.
Probably one of the worst classes in the entire Biology Program at Ottawa. Final Exam was extremely long and difficult. Exam questions do not relate to in class problems and textbook questions.
INSULT to education..please get out of this university now....

The professor had a helpful webiste. His midterms reflected the class material. His case-based approach was helpful in forcing students to keep up with the course work.  But...his exam (short answer) did not reflect his midterms. Overall, I liked the course and would recommend genetics to any one interested in a straight-forward teaching approch

This prof is by far the worst! he's lecture jump from topic to topic. He assumes you are fully aware of GENETICS. Of all else, his exam doesn't make sense, irrelavent to class. Stay away from this guy. He'll lower your average significantly.

honestly this man is an insult to higher education, he's a terrible teacher, doesn't understand the material himself, and makes terribly unfair midterms. Dont get me wrong i got 23/25 on it, but i've never stepped foot in his classroom other than for midterms. switch to the french section even if you don't speak french.

This has been the worst University of Ottawa experience in my life. Keeps on telling us to pretend we're CSI agents yet the exam is designed to trick you. Many good students are doing bad in this class. Sign up to the French section if you can - otherwise stay out of uOttawa in the first place.

Professor makes exam very irrelevant with respect to the rest of the course. His "case based approach" is very confusing and is designed to win himself some award. He limits the time he is available to students - telling us he cannot answer e-mails since he is on some "prestigious teaching committee". Never admits to mistakes on the marking scheme.
He is an awesome prof to have in animal physiology!! I really learned a lot in his class, he was very helpful and enthusiastic about the material.

this proff can make life a lot harder than its supposed to be. He is not clear and very confusing. He keeps warning about the content every now n then but he puts no effort in teachin it well. AVOID HIM

I found that I the best thing to do in his classes is to ignore everything he says and just read the text book. He does not understand the material and struggles to explain even the simplest of concepts. Overall his classes are relatively easy though and exams focus on understanding and not memorization of pointless facts, which is good.

It would really help if he understood the material that he is supposed to teach. He makes all sorts of mistakes in class and on the midterms. The mistakes he makes are the kind that any interested student who studies on their own can pick out instantly. Overall... good course, bad prof.
Pretty Good Prof. Mid term is fair but make sure you go over everything in the notes even if he didn't cover it in class
